We do not store any of your keys in our databases.
If you lose them, you would not be able to access your account. FAQ Check for Updates Social Links Got it Scan results not found. The scanned result is not an Account Address. Discarding scanned results. Retry Cancel No VPN history found in MAINNET. No VPN nodes available in MAINNET, switch to TESTNET. No Transaction History found in MAINNET. Logout Logging out will clear your keystore file, make sure you have saved it. Language Select Language Referral ID Referral Link View Tx History for Payment Done Successfully Send To or Scan To Send Referral code Referrals Send to… Enter Password to Create User ID You have not copied your Private Key.
Please copy your Private key to proceed. TESTNET %1s ON OFF Upload Keystore file Keystore File Uploaded Welcome to the Sentinel Referral Utility Drop.

Users who test this Lite Client will be able to claim their reward(s) after 21 or so days from the time that they had first installed the application and consumed a minimum of 100 MB of data from the Sentinel dVPN community hosted network.

The referral air drop reward schedule is as follows: 

500 SENT : For downloading the Sentinel Android Google Play Client and using 100 MB of data 

300 SENT : For downloading the Sentinel Network Client which includes a mobile ERC20 wallet. This client will have to be downloaded by users in order to claim $SENT

200 SENT : For every referral who downloads either SLC or SNC Your referral tokens can be claimed when you make your first VPN payment. No. of referrals Total reward tokens earned Share Link Address Share address Hey, check out this new dVPN android app. Use my Referral ID to get free tokens when you sign up.

Referral ID: %1$s

Link: %2$s Hey, check out this new dVPN Android app. Use my Referral ID to get free tokens when you Sign Up.
Referral ID: %1$s Share your Referral ID to earn tokens for every Sign Up Secure decentralized VPN with built-in crypto wallet Share the Sentinel app with friends, use the dVPN App and get incentivized for community development & decentralization of the network Decentralized VPN right at your finger tips
Use VPN and pay in tokens
Send and receive tokens You are connected to a VPN.
Disconnect the VPN to logout. You have claimed your free referral tokens.
View the updated token balance in your wallet. Unable to reach server. Please retry. Storage not found. Unable to store keystore file. Adding referral details. Please wait… Yes No Claiming referral bonus. Please wait… Claim Bonus Update Available A new version has been released and is available for download.

Kindly download and install the latest version in order to use the app. Downloading… Download You have entered an invalid Referral ID. Please enter valid Referral Id You have not entered a referral code.

Do you wish to continue without applying a referral code? There are no items to display. The VPN connection has been dropped as it failed to re-connect to the VPN node.
Please reconnect. Can claim after: %s Read More Please rate your experience with the previous dVPN session Please select rating Skip Rate

Fetching VPN server credentials… Connection statistics Ongoing statistics of the established OpenVPN connection Connection status change Status changes of the OpenVPN connection (Connecting, authenticating,…) Connecting to VPN… Icon of app trying to use OpenVPN for Android By proceeding, you are giving the application permission to completely control OpenVPN for Android and to intercept all network traffic.Do NOT accept unless you trust the application. Otherwise, you run the risk of having your data compromised by malicious software." I trust this application. %1$s attempts to control %2$s No error found Pausing connection in screen off state: less than %1$s in %2$ss Warning: Persistent tun not enabled for this VPN. Traffic will use the normal Internet connection when the screen is off. Network Status: %s Reread (%d) log items from log cache file %10$s %9$s running on %3$s %1$s (%2$s), Android %6$s (%7$s) API %4$d, ABI %5$s, (%8$s) official build debug build built by %s Waiting %ss seconds between connection attempt Using proxy %1$s %2$d Password Authentication failed %.0f bit/s %.1f kbit/s %.1f Mbit/s %.1f Gbit/s %.0f B %.1f kB %.1f MB %.1f GB VPN permission revoked by OS (e.g. other VPN program started), stopping VPN %1$s - %2$s Not connected Restarting OpenVPN Service (App crashed probably crashed or killed for memory pressure) Building configuration… Opening tun interface: Refusing to open tun device without IP information Could not add DNS Server "%1$s", rejected by the system: %2$s Could not configure IP Address "%1$s", rejected by the system: %2$s Ignoring multicast route: %s Route rejected by Android Local IPv4: %1$s/%2$d IPv6: %3$s MTU: %4$d DNS Server: %1$s, Domain: %2$s Routes: %1$s %2$s Routes excluded: %1$s %2$s VpnService routes installed: %1$s %2$s %1$s - %2$s %1$s - %3$s, %2$s No DNS servers being used. Name resolution may not work. Consider setting custom DNS Servers. Please also note that Android will keep using your proxy settings specified for your mobile/Wi-Fi connection when no DNS servers are set. Failed to open the tun interface "Error: " On some custom ICS images the permission on /dev/tun might be wrong, or the tun module might be missing completely. For CM9 images try the fix ownership option under general settings Package %s is no longer installed, removing it from app allow/disallow list No allowed app added. Adding ourselves (%s) to have at least one app in the allowed app list to not allow all apps Disallowed VPN apps: %1$s Allowed VPN apps: %1$s Cannot make sense of %1$s and %2$s as IP route with CIDR netmask, using /32 as netmask. Corrected route %1$s/%2$s to %3$s/%2$s Got interface information %1$s and %2$s, assuming second address is peer address of remote. Using /32 netmask for local IP. Mode given by OpenVPN is "%3$s". Vpn topology "%3$s" specified but IP Config %1$s %2$s looks more like an IP address with a network mask. Assuming "subnet" topology. ↓:%2$s(%1$s)-↑:%4$s(%3$s) Not running OpenVPN crashed unexpectedly. Error getting proxy settings: %s Preferred native ABI precedence of this device (%1$s) and ABI reported by native libraries (%2$s) mismatch %3$s: %1$s

%2$s Unhandled exception: %1$s

%2$s Unknown state Connecting Waiting for server reply Authenticating Getting client configuration Assigning IP addresses Adding routes Connected Disconnect Reconnecting Exiting Resolving host names Connecting (TCP) Waiting for usable network VPN paused - screen off VPN pause requested by user Cannot display certificate information Cannot access the Android Keychain Certificates. This can be caused by a firmware upgrade or by restoring a backup of the app/app settings. Please edit the VPN and reselect the certificate under basic settings to recreate the permission to access the certificate. Some versions of Android 4.1 have problems if the name of the keystore certificate contains non alphanumeric characters (like spaces, underscores or dashes). Try to reimport the certificate without special characters No CA Certificate returned while reading from Android keystore. Authentication will probably fail. You must select a User certificate You must select a CA certificate KeyChain Access error: %s Config uses option tls-remote that was deprecated in 2.3 and finally removed in 2.4 Error parsing the IPv4 address Profile specified in shortcut not found Waiting for user permission to use VPN API Waiting for user VPN password VPN API permission dialog cancelled.

Please grant this permission to use VPN services If you did not get a VPN confirmation dialog, you have "Always on VPN" enabled for another app. In that case only that app is allowed to connect to a VPN. Check under Settings-> Networks more .. -> VPNS Error in Configuration Your image does not support the VPNService API. Error parsing the custom routes tls-auth file is missing Missing user certificate or user certifcate key file Missing CA certificate You need to define and enable at least one remote server. PKCS12 File Encryption Key Private Key Password Error signing with Android keystore key %1$s: %2$s Help You currently do not have any Transaction history. There are no unoccupied VPNs available at the moment. Encryption %s OK Setting-up Device. Please wait… Downloading…
